articles.author: Erin Banco, Phil Stewart
articles.description: The U.S. decision to allow Ukraine to fire American weapons deeper into Russia has not increased the risk of a nuclear attack, which is unlikely, despite Russian President Vladimir Putin's increasingly bellicose statements, five sources familiar with U.S. intelligence told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Nuclear attack unlikely despite Putin's warnings, US intelligence says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli tank fire hit three towns along Lebanon's southeast border with Israel on Thursday, Lebanese security sources and state media said, a day after a ceasefire barring "offensive military operations" came into force.
articles.title: Israeli tank fires at 3 south Lebanese towns, Lebanese security sources, media say

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Tom Perry, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: With the bodies of its fighters still strewn on the battlefield, Hezbollah must bury its dead and provide succour to its supporters who bore the brunt of Israel's offensive, as the first steps on a long and costly road to recovery, four senior officials said.
articles.title: Still counting its dead, Hezbollah faces long road to recover from war

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden's administration is preparing a $725 million weapons package for Ukraine, two U.S. officials said on Wednesday, as the outgoing president seeks to bolster the government in Kyiv before leaving office in January.
articles.title: Exclusive: Biden readies $725 million arms aid package for Ukraine, sources say

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces stepped up bombardments on central areas and pushed tanks deeper in the north and south of the enclave.
articles.title: Israel ups bombing in central Gaza, strikes kill 17 people

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea grappled with heavy snowfall for a second day on Thursday, with dozens of flights cancelled, ferry operations suspended and at least four people reported dead in a bitter winter, though conditions showed signs of easing.
articles.title: South Korea battles second day of heavy snow; four dead

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Proceedings were disrupted for a second day by lawmakers calling for a discussion of US accusations of bribery and fraud against the ports-to-power Adani Group.
articles.title: India's parliament suspended temporarily after row over allegations against Adani group

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China warned on Thursday it would take "necessary actions" to protect Chinese firms if the U.S. escalated chip control measures, following reports that the Biden administration could unveil new export restrictions as soon as this week.
articles.title: China warns of 'necessary actions' if US escalates chip curbs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indonesian rescuers are searching for passengers trapped in a minibus buried in mud after flash floods and landslides hit several locations in North Sumatra province, killing at least 27, an official said on Thursday.
articles.title: Landslides in Indonesia's Sumatra kill at least 27, rescuers search for missing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Somalia's federal government and the country's Jubbaland region have issued reciprocal arrest warrants for their respective leaders in an escalating dispute over the conduct of elections in Jubbaland.
articles.title: Somali leaders face reciprocal arrest warrants over disputed regional election
